title: Ok's relative converse theorem for square integrable representations
abstract:
Let $E/F$ be a non Archimedean local field and $\psi:\frac{E}{F}\to
\mathbb{C}$ a non trivial character. Using harmonic analysis on Harish-Chandra
Schwartz spaces, we prove that if $n$ is an integer at least equal to two and
$\pi$ is a square integrable representation of $GL_n(E)$ such that
$\gamma(\pi,\pi',\psi)=1$ for any $GL_{n-1}(F)$-distinguished tempered
representation $\pi'$ of $GL_{n-1}(E)$, then $\pi$ is $GL_n(F)$-distinguished.
